docs.abstract: LEAD: Bangladesh will be even poorer next year as economic growth slows because of flooding and a trade imbalance, the World Bank reported this week. It said the economy would grow only 1.2 percent in the fiscal year that began last July 1.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bangladesh will be even poorer next year as economic growth slows because of flooding and a trade imbalance, the World Bank reported this week. It said the economy would grow only 1.2 percent in the fiscal year that began last July 1.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

docs.abstract: LEAD: A passenger ferry capsized in the Jamuna River near Dhaka and at least 60 people were feared drowned, the police said today. The ferry was carrying at least 70 passengers when it capsized during a sudden rainstorm on Sunday near Manikganj, about 35 miles northwest of Dhaka, the police said.
docs.lead_paragraph: A passenger ferry capsized in the Jamuna River near Dhaka and at least 60 people were feared drowned, the police said today. The ferry was carrying at least 70 passengers when it capsized during a sudden rainstorm on Sunday near Manikganj, about 35 miles northwest of Dhaka, the police said.

docs.abstract: LEAD: The police fired tear gas and rifles today at Muslims who ransacked a shoe store to protest sandals that they considered blasphemous, and news reports said at least one person was killed and 50 were wounded. The police in Tongi, 20 miles north of Dhaka, confirmed that they opened fire but refused to give details.
docs.lead_paragraph: The police fired tear gas and rifles today at Muslims who ransacked a shoe store to protest sandals that they considered blasphemous, and news reports said at least one person was killed and 50 were wounded. The police in Tongi, 20 miles north of Dhaka, confirmed that they opened fire but refused to give details. Officials said Muslims attacked shops owned by the Canada-based Bata Shoe Company because a design on the inner soles of the slippers resembles the Arabic characters for Allah.

docs.abstract: LEAD: A cyclone that tore across Bangladesh and eastern India on Saturday killed at least 84 people and left more than half a million homeless, officials and news reports said today. Tens of thousands of mud and straw huts were blown away during the storm, which was accompanied by winds of up to 85 miles per hour, they said.
docs.lead_paragraph: A cyclone that tore across Bangladesh and eastern India on Saturday killed at least 84 people and left more than half a million homeless, officials and news reports said today. Tens of thousands of mud and straw huts were blown away during the storm, which was accompanied by winds of up to 85 miles per hour, they said. At least 49 people died in India and 35 in Bangladesh, they said. Officials said the death toll was likely to rise because at least 150 fishermen were missing and feared dead in the Bay of Bengal.

docs.abstract: LEAD: The official death toll from Bangladesh's worst train disaster rose to 135 today. More than 1,000 people were injured when two crowded trains crashed head-on Sudnay at Pubail, 15 miles from Dhaka.
docs.lead_paragraph: The official death toll from Bangladesh's worst train disaster rose to 135 today. More than 1,000 people were injured when two crowded trains crashed head-on Sudnay at Pubail, 15 miles from Dhaka.

docs.abstract: LEAD: A tornado in central Bangladesh killed 600 people, injured 12,000 and devastated more than 20 villages, the Government said today. At least 200 people were reported missing.
docs.lead_paragraph: A tornado in central Bangladesh killed 600 people, injured 12,000 and devastated more than 20 villages, the Government said today. At least 200 people were reported missing.

docs.abstract: LEAD: President H. M. Ershad, who seized power in a bloodless coup in 1982, is searching for a formula that will allow him to hold early parliamentary elections, politicians of all parties say.
docs.lead_paragraph: President H. M. Ershad, who seized power in a bloodless coup in 1982, is searching for a formula that will allow him to hold early parliamentary elections, politicians of all parties say.

headline.main: Bangladesh's Leader Woos the Opposition Again
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh's Leader Woos the Opposition Again

byline.original: By Barbara Crossette, Special To the New York Times

docs.abstract: LEAD: As monsoon rains begin to fall again on Bangladesh, the World Bank is mobilizing an international force of scientists and aid officials to draft a comprehensive, long-term plan to save this vulnerable nation from perennial catastrophe.
docs.lead_paragraph: As monsoon rains begin to fall again on Bangladesh, the World Bank is mobilizing an international force of scientists and aid officials to draft a comprehensive, long-term plan to save this vulnerable nation from perennial catastrophe.

docs.abstract: LEAD: A cold wave in normally tropical northern Bangladesh has killed at least 33 people in the last week, a newspaper reported today.

docs.abstract: LEAD: For more than a decade, India has secretly provided arms and money to tribal insurgents fighting for an autonomous state in Bangladesh, rebels given sanctuary in this border area say.
docs.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, India has secretly provided arms and money to tribal insurgents fighting for an autonomous state in Bangladesh, rebels given sanctuary in this border area say.

headline.main: Bangladeshi Insurgents Say India Is Supporting Them
